primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in a world accursed by broken relationships (hell) to restore humanity to Himself and one another through the advent of Christ (heaven).

tekstueel_bewijs: The day when I act, says the Lord of hosts
He comes to make his blessings flow, far as the curse is found

object.identificatie: Restored relationships / The Hope of Glory

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Liturgical Promise
tekstueel_bewijs: The Word became flesh and dwelt among us
For you who fear my name
So that we might be restored to him and to one another

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Holy Spirit (implied in 'means of grace')
tekstueel_bewijs: Heaven is seen in the face of Jesus Christ

tegenstander.identificatie: The Curse / Unassisted Human Nature / The Wrath of God
tekstueel_bewijs: Unassisted human nature is under the sign of the wrath of God
The mess we have made of our lives
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but an ontological 'curse' and 'wrath' that humans cannot overcome alone.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer, having received grace, mirrors heaven through small acts of reconciliation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly dependent on the primary (soteriology): 'He can use you...'

voorbeelden_god_subject: He comes to make his blessings flow.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We cannot make heaven break in.

voorbeelden: A time for looking toward the future kingdom.
I appreciate the General Thanksgiving as one of the Prayer Book’s greatest treasures.
Unassisted human nature cannot turn the hearts...
Human nature is unassisted no longer.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the lack of human power (impotence) and the divine endowment of power (grace).

primaire_tegenstelling.niet_s2: Hope of Glory (Negation of the Curse)

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at ~S1 (Conflict), moves to S2 (The Curse/Wrath), then to ~S2 (Hope/Advent), and finally to S1 (Restoration in Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes the curse (S2) to enable the restoration (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the preacher uses 'wrath' and 'hell' to describe the gravity of the human condition.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly denies human capacity to achieve the object and places the agency entirely on God's intervention in Christ.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: He can use you to make a little piece of heaven come.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: You and I cannot make heaven break in... Only God can do this.
Unassisted human nature is under the sign of the wrath of God.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is presented as the definition of Love/Beatitudes, but not merely as a model to imitate, rather as a life to be 'grafted into'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by stating we must be 'assimilated to him' rather than just copying him.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope; moving from the burden of 'fixing' relationships to receiving God's healing.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic restoration of the relational sphere.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the cosmic apocalypse of Malachi to the 'small' hell of family conflict is masterfully handled.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Heaven is not yet' and 'Heaven is to be mirrored right now'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Love that bore all things and endured all things, even to the cross, so that we might be restored.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment; 'Human nature is unassisted no longer.'

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is described as a 'curse' and 'wrath' that destroys generations.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a clear theocentric structure where God is the Subject of the primary narrative program of restoration.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of how to address practical human suffering (family conflict) without lapsing into moralism, by keeping God as the primary Actant.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'family conflict' anecdotes, Greimasian analysis reveals these are actantial 'Opponents' that only a Divine Subject can overcome.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical Malachi; semiotics shows how Malachi's structure (Curse vs. Sun) is mapped onto the hearer's current reality.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'hope' in the sermon is not a human emotion (Subjective) but a Narrative Object provided by a Divine Sender.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Time Between' as a semiotic space to transition from the Old Testament 'Curse' to the New Testament 'Glory'.
